verses.text_plain: I made a covenant with mine eyes; why then should I think upon a maid?
verses.verse_html: 1I made a covenant with mine eyes; why then should I think upon a maid?

verses.text_plain: For what portion of God is there from above? and what inheritance of the Almighty from on high?
verses.verse_html: 2For what portion of God is there from above? and what inheritance of the Almighty from on high?

verses.text_plain: Is not destruction to the wicked? and a strange punishment to the workers of iniquity?
verses.verse_html: 3Is not destruction to the wicked? and a strange punishment to the workers of iniquity?

verses.text_plain: Doth not he see my ways, and count all my steps?
verses.verse_html: 4Doth not he see my ways, and count all my steps?

verses.text_plain: If I have walked with vanity, or if my foot hath hasted to deceit;
verses.verse_html: 5If I have walked with vanity, or if my foot hath hasted to deceit;

verses.text_plain: Let me be weighed in an even balance, that God may know mine integrity.
verses.verse_html:
6Let me be weighed in an even balance, that God may know mine integrity. ▼
▼ Let…: Heb. Let him weigh me in balances of justice

footnotes.body_text: ▼ Let…: Heb. Let him weigh me in balances of justice
footnotes.body_html: ▼ Let…: Heb. Let him weigh me in balances of justice

verses.text_plain: If my step hath turned out of the way, and mine heart walked after mine eyes, and if any blot hath cleaved to mine hands;
verses.verse_html: 7If my step hath turned out of the way, and mine heart walked after mine eyes, and if any blot hath cleaved to mine hands;

verses.text_plain: Then let me sow, and let another eat; yea, let my offspring be rooted out.
verses.verse_html: 8Then let me sow, and let another eat; yea, let my offspring be rooted out.

verses.text_plain: If mine heart have been deceived by a woman, or if I have laid wait at my neighbour’s door;
verses.verse_html: 9If mine heart have been deceived by a woman, or if I have laid wait at my neighbour’s door;

verses.text_plain: Then let my wife grind unto another, and let others bow down upon her.
verses.verse_html: 10Then let my wife grind unto another, and let others bow down upon her.

verses.text_plain: For this is an heinous crime; yea, it is an iniquity to be punished by the judges.
verses.verse_html: 11For this is an heinous crime; yea, it is an iniquity to be punished by the judges.

verses.text_plain: For it is a fire that consumeth to destruction, and would root out all mine increase.
verses.verse_html: 12For it is a fire that consumeth to destruction, and would root out all mine increase.

verses.text_plain: If I did despise the cause of my manservant or of my maidservant, when they contended with me;
verses.verse_html: 13If I did despise the cause of my manservant or of my maidservant, when they contended with me;

verses.text_plain: What then shall I do when God riseth up? and when he visiteth, what shall I answer him?
verses.verse_html: 14What then shall I do when God riseth up? and when he visiteth, what shall I answer him?

verses.text_plain: Did not he that made me in the womb make him? and did not one fashion us in the womb?
verses.verse_html:
15Did not he that made me in the womb make him? and did not one fashion us in the womb? ▼
▼ did not one…: or, did he not fashion us in one womb?

footnotes.body_text: ▼ did not one…: or, did he not fashion us in one womb?
footnotes.body_html: ▼ did not one…: or, did he not fashion us in one womb?

verses.text_plain: If I have withheld the poor from their desire, or have caused the eyes of the widow to fail;
verses.verse_html: 16If I have withheld the poor from their desire, or have caused the eyes of the widow to fail;

verses.text_plain: Or have eaten my morsel myself alone, and the fatherless hath not eaten thereof;
verses.verse_html: 17Or have eaten my morsel myself alone, and the fatherless hath not eaten thereof;

verses.text_plain: (For from my youth he was brought up with me, as with a father, and I have guided her from my mother’s womb;)
verses.verse_html:
18(For from my youth he was brought up with me, as with a father, and I have guided her from my mother’s womb;) ▼
▼ her: that is, the widow

footnotes.body_html: ▼ her: that is, the widow

verses.text_plain: If I have seen any perish for want of clothing, or any poor without covering;
verses.verse_html: 19If I have seen any perish for want of clothing, or any poor without covering;

verses.text_plain: If his loins have not blessed me, and if he were not warmed with the fleece of my sheep;
verses.verse_html: 20If his loins have not blessed me, and if he were not warmed with the fleece of my sheep;

verses.text_plain: If I have lifted up my hand against the fatherless, when I saw my help in the gate:
verses.verse_html: 21If I have lifted up my hand against the fatherless, when I saw my help in the gate:

verses.text_plain: Then let mine arm fall from my shoulder blade, and mine arm be broken from the bone.
verses.verse_html:
22Then let mine arm fall from my shoulder blade, and mine arm be broken from the bone. ▼
▼ bone: or, chanelbone

verses.text_plain: For destruction from God was a terror to me, and by reason of his highness I could not endure.
verses.verse_html: 23For destruction from God was a terror to me, and by reason of his highness I could not endure.

tokens.text: to me, and by reason of his highness

verses.text_plain: If I have made gold my hope, or have said to the fine gold, Thou art my confidence;
verses.verse_html: 24If I have made gold my hope, or have said to the fine gold, Thou art my confidence;

verses.text_plain: If I rejoiced because my wealth was great, and because mine hand had gotten much;
verses.verse_html:
25If I rejoiced because my wealth was great, and because mine hand had gotten much; ▼
▼ gotten…: Heb. found much

footnotes.body_html: ▼ gotten…: Heb. found much

verses.text_plain: If I beheld the sun when it shined, or the moon walking in brightness;
verses.verse_html:
26If I beheld the sun when it shined, or the moon walking in brightness; ▼
▼ sun: Heb. light
 , ▼
▼ in…: Heb. bright

verses.text_plain: And my heart hath been secretly enticed, or my mouth hath kissed my hand:
verses.verse_html:
27And my heart hath been secretly enticed, or my mouth hath kissed my hand: ▼
▼ my mouth…: Heb. my hand hath kissed my mouth

footnotes.body_text: ▼ my mouth…: Heb. my hand hath kissed my mouth
footnotes.body_html: ▼ my mouth…: Heb. my hand hath kissed my mouth

verses.text_plain: This also were an iniquity to be punished by the judge: for I should have denied the God that is above.
verses.verse_html: 28This also were an iniquity to be punished by the judge: for I should have denied the God that is above.

verses.text_plain: If I rejoiced at the destruction of him that hated me, or lifted up myself when evil found him:
verses.verse_html: 29If I rejoiced at the destruction of him that hated me, or lifted up myself when evil found him:

verses.text_plain: Neither have I suffered my mouth to sin by wishing a curse to his soul.
verses.verse_html:
30Neither have I suffered my mouth to sin by wishing a curse to his soul. ▼
▼ mouth: Heb. palate

verses.text_plain: If the men of my tabernacle said not, Oh that we had of his flesh! we cannot be satisfied.
verses.verse_html: 31If the men of my tabernacle said not, Oh that we had of his flesh! we cannot be satisfied.

verses.text_plain: The stranger did not lodge in the street: but I opened my doors to the traveller.
verses.verse_html:
32The stranger did not lodge in the street: but I opened my doors to the traveller. ▼
▼ traveller: or, way

verses.text_plain: If I covered my transgressions as Adam, by hiding mine iniquity in my bosom:
verses.verse_html:
33If I covered my transgressions as Adam, by hiding mine iniquity in my bosom: ▼
▼ as Adam: or, after the manner of men

footnotes.body_text: ▼ as Adam: or, after the manner of men
footnotes.body_html: ▼ as Adam: or, after the manner of men

verses.text_plain: Did I fear a great multitude, or did the contempt of families terrify me, that I kept silence, and went not out of the door?
verses.verse_html: 34Did I fear a great multitude, or did the contempt of families terrify me, that I kept silence, and went not out of the door?

verses.text_plain: Oh that one would hear me! behold, my desire is, that the Almighty would answer me, and that mine adversary had written a book.
verses.verse_html:
35Oh that one would hear me! behold, my desire is, that the Almighty would answer me, and that mine adversary had written a book. ▼
▼ my…: or, my sign is that the Almighty will

footnotes.body_text: ▼ my…: or, my sign is that the Almighty will
footnotes.body_html: ▼ my…: or, my sign is that the Almighty will

verses.text_plain: Surely I would take it upon my shoulder, and bind it as a crown to me.
verses.verse_html: 36Surely I would take it upon my shoulder, and bind it as a crown to me.

verses.text_plain: I would declare unto him the number of my steps; as a prince would I go near unto him.
verses.verse_html: 37I would declare unto him the number of my steps; as a prince would I go near unto him.

verses.text_plain: If my land cry against me, or that the furrows likewise thereof complain;
verses.verse_html:
38If my land cry against me, or that the furrows likewise thereof complain; ▼
▼ complain: Heb. weep

tokens.text: against me, or that the furrows

verses.text_plain: If I have eaten the fruits thereof without money, or have caused the owners thereof to lose their life:
verses.verse_html:
39If I have eaten the fruits thereof without money, or have caused the owners thereof to lose their life: ▼
▼ fruits: Heb. strength
 , ▼
▼ the owners…: Heb. the soul of the owners thereof to expire, or, breathe out

footnotes.body_text: ▼ the owners…: Heb. the soul of the owners thereof to expire, or, breathe out
footnotes.body_html: ▼ the owners…: Heb. the soul of the owners thereof to expire, or, breathe out

verses.text_plain: Let thistles grow instead of wheat, and cockle instead of barley. The words of Job are ended.
verses.verse_html:
40Let thistles grow instead of wheat, and cockle instead of barley. The words of Job are ended. ▼
▼ cockle: or, noisome weeds

footnotes.body_html: ▼ cockle: or, noisome weeds
